title: Implement pagination iterator (ListAll)
description:
Implement Go 1.23+ iterator pattern for memory-efficient pagination.

## Requirements
From PRD Section 5 (Pagination Iterator-Pattern):

```go
// ListAll returns an iterator over all entries
// Uses Go 1.23+ iter.Seq or custom implementation
func (s *BooksService) ListAll(ctx context.Context) iter.Seq2[*Book, error]

// Usage:
for book, err := range client.Books.ListAll(ctx) {
    if err != nil {
        return err
    }
    fmt.Println(book.Name)
}
```

## Technical Details
- Go 1.23+ iter.Seq2 for yield-based iteration
- Memory-efficient: only one page in memory at a time
- Supports early break
- Handle 10,000+ entries without memory issues

## Pagination Parameters
- count: 100 default, max 500
- offset: auto-incremented per page
- total: from API response to know when done

## Services to Implement
- BooksService.ListAll()
- PagesService.ListAll()
- ChaptersService.ListAll() (v0.2)
- ShelvesService.ListAll() (v0.2)
- SearchService.SearchAll() (v0.2)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] iter.Seq2 based iterator implementation
- [ ] Automatic pagination through all results
- [ ] Early termination works correctly
- [ ] Error propagation through iterator
- [ ] Unit tests for pagination logic

title: Implement error types and APIError
description:
Create error handling infrastructure with sentinel errors and APIError type.

## Requirements
From PRD Section 9 (Error-Handling-Strategie):

```go
var (
    ErrNotFound     = errors.New("bookstack: resource not found")
    ErrUnauthorized = errors.New("bookstack: unauthorized")
    ErrForbidden    = errors.New("bookstack: forbidden")
    ErrRateLimited  = errors.New("bookstack: rate limited")
    ErrBadRequest   = errors.New("bookstack: bad request")
)

type APIError struct {
    StatusCode int
    Code       int    `json:"code"`
    Message    string `json:"message"`
    Body       []byte
}

func (e *APIError) Error() string
func (e *APIError) Is(target error) bool  // Maps status codes to sentinel errors
```

## Status Code Mapping
- 400 -> ErrBadRequest
- 401 -> ErrUnauthorized
- 403 -> ErrForbidden
- 404 -> ErrNotFound
- 429 -> ErrRateLimited

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All sentinel errors defined
- [ ] APIError struct with Error() method
- [ ] APIError.Is() correctly maps status codes
- [ ] errors.Is() works with wrapped APIError
- [ ] Unit tests for error matching
